items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are now falling slowly on the River Thame. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible today (21/03/22) especially between Stadhampton and Dorchester. The forecast is for a dry day and start to the week.   
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message this evening, 21/03/22, or as the situation changes. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are now falling steadily on the River Ray. Flooding of low lying roads and land is possible today 21/03/22, especially in the Islip area. The forecast is for a dry day and start to the week.   
We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message this evening, 21/03/22, or as the situation changes.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. The forecast is to remain dry today (21/03/22) and for the next few days. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.
